intro: Azalea falconeri, commonly known as the Canary Islands azalea, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Rhododendron genus and belongs to the Ericaceae family. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and prefers a humid, cool climate. Azalea falconeri is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
